004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.pidwrappers;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DigitalSource;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Encoder;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSourceType;
011
012/** Wrapper so that PIDSource is implemented for Encoder for old PIDController. */
013public class PIDEncoder extends Encoder implements PIDSource {
014  private PIDSourceType m_pidSource = PIDSourceType.kDisplacement;
015
016  public PIDEncoder(final int channelA, final int channelB, boolean reverseDirection) {
017    super(channelA, channelB, reverseDirection, EncodingType.k4X);
018  }
019
020  public PIDEncoder(final int channelA, final int channelB) {
021    super(channelA, channelB, false);
022  }
023
024  public PIDEncoder(
025      final int channelA,
026      final int channelB,
027      boolean reverseDirection,
028      final EncodingType encodingType) {
029    super(channelA, channelB, reverseDirection, encodingType);
030  }
031
032  public PIDEncoder(
033      final int channelA, final int channelB, final int indexChannel, boolean reverseDirection) {
034    super(channelA, channelB, indexChannel, reverseDirection);
035  }
036
037  public PIDEncoder(final int channelA, final int channelB, final int indexChannel) {
038    super(channelA, channelB, indexChannel, false);
039  }
040
041  public PIDEncoder(DigitalSource sourceA, DigitalSource sourceB, boolean reverseDirection) {
042    super(sourceA, sourceB, reverseDirection, EncodingType.k4X);
043  }
044
045  public PIDEncoder(DigitalSource sourceA, DigitalSource sourceB) {
046    super(sourceA, sourceB, false);
047  }
048
049  public PIDEncoder(
050      DigitalSource sourceA,
051      DigitalSource sourceB,
052      boolean reverseDirection,
053      final EncodingType encodingType) {
054    super(sourceA, sourceB, reverseDirection, encodingType);
055  }
056
057  public PIDEncoder(
058      DigitalSource sourceA,
059      DigitalSource sourceB,
060      DigitalSource indexSource,
061      boolean reverseDirection) {
062    super(sourceA, sourceB, indexSource, reverseDirection);
063  }
064
065  public PIDEncoder(DigitalSource sourceA, DigitalSource sourceB, DigitalSource indexSource) {
066    super(sourceA, sourceB, indexSource, false);
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Set which parameter of the encoder you are using as a process control variable. The encoder
071   * class supports the rate and distance parameters.
072   *
073   * @param pidSource An enum to select the parameter.
074   */
075  @Override
076  public void setPIDSourceType(PIDSourceType pidSource) {
077    m_pidSource = pidSource;
078  }
079
080  @Override
081  public PIDSourceType getPIDSourceType() {
082    return m_pidSource;
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Implement the PIDSource interface.
087   *
088   * @return The current value of the selected source parameter.
089   */
090  @Override
091  public double pidGet() {
092    switch (m_pidSource) {
093      case kDisplacement:
094        return getDistance();
095      case kRate:
096        return getRate();
097      default:
098        return 0.0;
099    }
100  }
101}
